description.text:
Boston Calling Music Festival is a three-day, multi-stage festival featuring some of the biggest and best acts in live music. It is held on Boston City Hall Plaza, May 27, 28, & 29, 2016. The event will be one big party with easy access to all performance areas, incredible beer, wine, food offerings, and more suprises to be announced. All ages are welcome and children under 10 are free. For more information, please consult bostoncalling.com. 
  
Friday performances by Sia, Sufjan Stevens, and Lisa Hannigan & Aaron Dessner. Weekend performances by Disclosure, Robyn, ODESZA, HAIM, Miike Snow, Janelle Monáe, City and Colour, Courtney Barnett, Elle King, The Front Bottoms, BØRNS, Charles Bradley and His Extraordinaires,The Vaccines, Vince Staples, Battles, Unknown Mortal Orchestra, Christine and The Queens, Lizzo, Palehound, and Michael Christmas. 
  
  
FRIDAY 
Box Office Opens: 5pm Gates Open: 6pm Music Ends: 11:00pm 
SATURDAY/SUNDAY 
Box Office Opens: 11am Gates Open: 12pm Music Ends: 11:00pm 
  
Ticketing Policies 
- Once you purchase, you will receive an order confirmation email from Eventbrite on behalf of Boston Calling. 
- IMPORTANT: If you do not see your order confirmation in your inbox, make sure to check your junk/spam folder. If you still do not see your order confirmation, click here to access the Eventbrite help center. 
- Your actual ticket will be available to download in your Eventbrite account on or around April 15, 2016.  You will be notified via the email address used at check-out when they are available.   
- Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable.  
- If you are having any other technical ticketing-related issues with your order, click here to contact Eventbrite. For general festival info, click here. 
  
FAQs 
What happens if it rains? 
Boston Calling is a rain or shine event. 
  
How do I get to City Hall Plaza? 
Main Entrance is location on Congress Street and we recommend taking the T to the Haymarket or State Street stations. We strongly encourage you to take public transportation. 
  
When is the performance schedule released? 
The performance schedule will be released a few weeks prior to the festival. If you want to be notified right away once the schedule is released, be sure to sign up for our mailing list or download our app. Artist lineup subject to change. 
  
Is the Festival accessible to people with disabilities?  
The entire plaza has various ramps accessing the multiple levels. ADA accessible restrooms are also available. ASL interpreters are only available upon request. 
  
Are there ATMs available if I run low on cash? 
Many ATMs will be located around the festival grounds. 
  
What will be available in the food/beer areas? 
Delicious food from Tasty Burger and many more. Beer and wine will be available to those who are 21+. Please make sure to bring proper ID and grab a wrist band from the ID Check tent by the main entrance. 
  
What about vegetarian items? 
Many food vendors will feature a vegetarian option. 
  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
Please email info@bostoncalling.com.

name.text: Game of Thrones Beer Release! Seven Kingdoms Hoppy Wheat & More!
name.html: Game of Thrones Beer Release! Seven Kingdoms Hoppy Wheat & More!

description.text:
Join us at the release party for the new Ommegang Game of Thrones Seven Kingdoms Hoppy Wheat Beer on Wednesday, 03/30 at PJ Ryans in Somerville! A night of treachery and blood lust. Bare bodies and goblets of beer. Knights and dragons. And more beer. 

From the cold plains of The North to the hot dunes of Dorne the Seven Kingdoms Hoppy Wheat Beer is sure to please. It's a marriage of Belgium yeast and hop-forward american IPAs! 


As dark as the Black Cells beneath King's Landing, Shadow Brewer Imperial Stout is an impressive 9.7% Imperial Stout that tastes of malt, coffee and chocolate! 


The Rosetta Kriek is a lighter fare.  A fruit beer that is just a touch sour and aged on cherries will have you dreaming of hot days in the Water Gardens. 

So come for the delicious beers and stay for the gold and glory (SWAG, yes there will be Game of Thrones Swag!!). RSVP as there is no doubt that this event will be popular!  
This event is free to attend, pay as you drink. 
They'll be serving some fantastic beers that are sure to run out fast! 
 
Ommegang Rosetta 
Fruit Beer - 5.6%
This elegant fruit beer, matured on cherries, is brewed exclusively for Brewery Ommegang by Liefmans, a sister brewery, in Belgium. 
Ommegang Glimmerglass 
Saison - 5.4%
New 2014 Spring release. Deep straw to light amber in color with a thick, pure white head. The saison yeast strain gives off fruity aromas of pear, apple and slight citrus balanced with a delicate floral hop character and a touch of spiciness. Taste is very clean, with pronounced fruit flavors, delicate bready malt followed by welcomed spicing. Crisp finish with lingering yet subtle notes of yeast and touches of fruity pepper. 
Ommegang Shadow Brewer 
Imperial Stout - 9.7%
Where the moonlight casts shadows and doubt toil a brewer, unleashing impassioned intentions in the form of an audacious stout. He finds freedom in his nocturnal efforts. He finds room under cover of night to seek flavors more darkly imagined roasted chocolate, with bitter black bite. Our Shadow Brewer pours black as night under a thick tan head. There, roasted malt, coffee and chocolate tastes and aromas give in to creamy notes, dark fruit, and pleasing bitterness. 
Seven Kingdoms 
American Wheat or Rye Beer - 6.9%
Seven Kingdoms is a marriage of a traditional Belgian-style wheat and a hop-forward American ale -- but unlike so many of the marriages on the show, the resulting hoppy wheat is pleasant, playful and inspired. At 6.9% ABV, it possesses a nuanced complexity that pairs nicely with the hop-forward characteristics that make it surprisingly refreshing. 
Mc Chouffe 
Belgian Dark Strong Ale - 8%
The Mc Chouffe is an unfiltered dark beer, which is re-fermented in the bottle as well as in the keg. Behind its fruity flavor a slight hint of bitterness may be found.

name.text: Stony Creek Debut Party! Barrel-Aged Cinnamon Chocolate Porter; Black Wheat Wine & More
name.html: Stony Creek Debut Party! Barrel-Aged Cinnamon Chocolate Porter; Black Wheat Wine & More

description.text:
Join us at Sunset Tap and Grill on Thursday 3/24 to celebrate the debut of Stony Creek Brewery in Massachusetts! With 8 great beers on taps that have never been sold in MA before you won'y want to miss this party!  

Sip on the Chahklit Baltic Porter - a tribute to Jamaican Chahklit tea - this beer is brewed with almonds, earthy Ceylon Cinnamon and cacao nibs and then aged in Caribbean rum barrels. 


The Reposado Negro is a Black Wheat Wine that has been aged in Tequila barrels. Roasted malt "charred" flavors mix beautifully with a sweetness from the tequila barrels. At 9.5% this one is boozy! 


Sun Juice is a tasty Belgian Summer Ale that's brewed with wheat and Saison yeast. It's also got a bit of orange peel, grapefruit peel, coriander and chamomile, reminding you that summer is coming!


The Stony Joe is a unique blend of styles. A golden mocha stout, it is Brewed like a milk stout but instead of dark malts they use English barley giving it a golden color. Throw in some cocoa nibs and roasted coffee and you have yourself a fantastic brew! 

With so many awesome beers to try you're gonna want to get their early (and maybe get a flight or two). So RSVP and we'll see you there!  
 
Sun Juice 
Saison - 5.3%
Sun Juice is a refreshing Belgian Summer Ale brewed with wheat. Saison yeast produces a silky body while orange peel, grapefruit peel, corriander , and chamomile impart a spicy and fruity complexity. It's summertime, grab youirself some Sun Juice. 
Chahklit Baltic Porter 
Baltic Porter - 8.5%
Grandma Clara makes Chahklit Tea for her family. She uses hand ground cacao pods, cinnamon leaf, almond, milk, and maybe the occasionaL splash of rum...for your health. This is our tribute to her Jamaican tradition. Chahklit is a Baltic Porter brewed with almonds and earthy Ceylon Cinnamon. Cacao Nibs impart rich chocolate depth. IT ages in Caribbean Rum Barrels to lend oak complexity and subtle Rum nuance. Sip it slowly and be transported back to Grandma Clara's kitchen. 
Reposado Negro 
American Barleywine - 9.2%
Reposado Tequila is known for its oak aged, smooth complexity. This is our interpretation of the fine Mexican spirit. Reposado Negro is A Black Wheat Wine aged in Tequila Barrels. A marriage of sweet alcohol warmth, smooth bready texture, and roasted malt "charred" flavors, this jet black brew will have you swearing you are sipping a top shelf tequila. 
Big Cranky Double IPA 
Imperial IPA - 9.5%
A Bold West Coast Double IPA, this is the crankiest of our IPAs. 7 different hops contribute complex and juicy hop character. Its dry finish allows the hops to stand out. At 9.5% ABV and 95 IBUs, while remarkably cranky, this beer is extraordinarily drinkable. 
Petite Cranky 
India Pale Ale (IPA)
This is an anniversary beer by stony creek. A session IPA with Saison yeast! 
Stony Joe 
Stout - 5.5%
Stony Joe is a Golden Mocha Stout. It is designed like a traditional Milk Stout but without using the typical roasted dark malts. Instead we use a boat load of rich, decadent golden colored English barley, flaked barley, flaked oats, and flaked wheat to give it lush body and smooth sweetness. We then ferment it on Cocoa Nibs and add fresh locally roasted Guatemalan Coffee, directly to the fermenter. The cocoa nibs and coffee add the rich mocha notes and bright roasty/coffee aroma! 
Snow Hole Imperial Red 
Imperial IPA - 8.5% 85 IBUs
A Snowhole is someone who loves a brutal winter. Our Double Red, with its malty notes of caramel and dark sugar, is complemented perfectly by intense citrus and spicy hops. 6 different hops, 8 hop additions, over 3.5 pounds of hops per barrel, 8.5% ABV and 85 IBUs make for a winter brew that can stand up to any storm. 
Black Water Pils 
Pilsner
This is a brand new Black Pilsner from Stoney Creek!

description.text:
Boston Comic Con 2016: New England's biggest and best comic book convention.  1. CELEBRITY PHOTO OP TICKETS will go on sale at a later date to be announced. 
2. CELEBRITY AUTOGRAPHS will go on sale at a later date to be announced. 
3. Show Hours:    Friday -  August 12, 2016 (12pm to 8pm) Saturday - August 13, 2016 (10am to 7pm) Sunday -  August  14, 2016 (10am to 6pm) 
*VIP Ticket Holders will be admitted to the show 30 minutes early each day.  4.  At the door ticket sales will only be available if the event has not been sold out, and will be sold at a premium over online ticket prices.   5. Event details can be found at on the Boston Comic Con website.  Click here.   6. Children 10 and under are free on Friday and do not need a ticket.  Children age 5 and under are free on Saturday and Sunday and do not need a ticket.  7.  Purchased tickets are e-mailed to the purchaser by Eventbrite.  Tickets can either be printed out or shown on a smart phone at the show.  Hard copy tickets are NOT mailed to the purchaser.  8.  Refund Policy:  Any ticket refund requests must be submitted by no later than Thursday 5pm EST August 11, 2016.  Refund requests after that date will not be considered for any reason whatsoever.   9. In order to request a refund please follow these instructions: Use Request a Refund from your Order Details. After logging in, go to your Current Orders by clicking My Tickets. When you find the order you want to refund and click on it, look for a button to Request a Refund and fill out the short contact form. When you're done writing your message, just click Send message and your message will be sent directly to the event organizer. Thank you.

description.text:
Small Business Expo is THE largest & most anticipated business-to-business networking event, trade show & conference for business owners, entrepreneurs & decision-makers.  If you are serious about your business, this Expo is a "MUST ATTEND EVENT." 
  
FREE TO ATTEND! REGISTER TODAY. 
Your FREE badge gives you full access to 
the Exhibitor Hall &  
20+ Business Critical Workshops. 
****WANT TO EXHIBIT?  Call us today at 212.404.2345*** 
  
Small Business Expo is the most anticipated networking event of the year for business professionals to learn about products & services to help their business exceed its goals, network with other industry professionals & attend informative and cutting-edge workshops & seminars. If you are a business owner, entrepreneur or someone that works for a small business you should attend this trade show & conference.  
WHY ATTEND? 

Network with thousands of business owners, entrepreneurs & start-ups
Establish hundreds of new contacts and reconnect with old ones.
Attend FREE business critical workshops & seminars.
Learn about new products and services that will help your business grow.
Interact with the movers and shakers of your industry.
Discover new and innovative technologies.
Be in the RIGHT place at the RIGHT time.
It's FREE to attend!

 
 

  
WANT TO EXHIBIT & SELL TO THOUSANDS OF BUSINESS OWNERS? 
If your product/service targets small business owners, exhibiting at this show is a must. Nowhere else can you reach thousands of business owners and make on-the-spot sales!  Call us at 212.404.2345 or VISIT OUR EXHIBITOR PAGE. 
FAQs 
Is there a dress code? 
Dress code is business casual. 
Is there an age limit to enter the event? 
Attendees must be 18 or older to attend Small Business Expo. 
What are my parking options at Hynes Convention Center? 
There are numerous parking garages located near the Hynes Convention Center.  CLICK HERE for a listing of parking garages. 
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
Please contact clientservices@theshowproducers.com 
Can I update my registration information? 
Yes, you may do so onsite at Registration the day of the show. 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
No, you can print your badge onsite at Registration the day of the show. 
What is the refund policy? 
Per our company policy, there are NO refunds. 
The name on the registration doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay? 
Yes, you may update this information onsite at Registration the day of the show.

description.text:
Each year, Boston University entertains, enthralls, and celebrates with graduates, families, and friends during Commencement Weekend. These events, specifically for graduates and their guests, serve as the ultimate celebration of our student's hard work. Most of these events require reservation and/or ticket purchase. Please include the graduate in all ticket purchases. Registration begins January 19, 2016 at 12pm EST. Events do sell out. Registration for events will close May 9, 2016 at 9AM EST.   
  
 Need Commencement Weekend Housing? Reserve yours here! 
  
If you have questions or need to cancel your order, please contact us at bugrad16@bu.edu or call 617-353-2248.  Order cancellations must be submitted by 5PM EST on April 15.  Refunds will not be given after this time. 
  
***IMPORTANT NOTE REGARDING POPS TICKETS: Pops tickets purchased before April 15 will be mailed to the address provided at checkout. Pops tickets purchased on and after April 15 will be not be mailed, and will be available at BU will call at Warren Towers from Thursday, May 12 until Saturday, May 14 at 6:00 PM. After that, tickets will be held at BU will call at Symphony Hall.

name.text: Solve Talks at Google: A thought-leadership speaker series in the heart of Kendall Square.
name.html: Solve Talks at Google: A thought-leadership speaker series in the heart of Kendall Square.

description.text:
Google is pairing up with Kara Miller, journalist and radio host (http://blogs.wgbh.org/innovation-hub/2015/1/1/about-innovation-hub/#about_kara); MIT's Solve program (http://solve.mit.edu/); and MassChallenge (http://masschallenge.org/) to bring you a new and exciting thought-leadership series in the heart of Kendall Square. 
You're invited to join us in Google's unique Cambridge location to explore a wide range of themes from income inequality to new research on obesity.  Come early for the networking reception, stay late to meet the panelists and network some more. 
Events in this series are from 5:30p-7:30p.  
PLEASE NOTE: When you receive yor PDF ticket via email, it is valid for the event date noted in the "Type" box at the bottom of the ticket . If you wish to attend more than one event in the series, please register for each on individually at: http://solve.mit.edu/GoogleTalks 
Check this site often for new themes and open registrations. 
  
Solve (http://solve.mit.edu) is a cross-disciplinary program led by MIT to convene the people and organizations that are addressing the world’s most pressing challenges in healthcare, energy, the environment, education, food & water, civil infrastructure and the economy.

name.text: Beer Camp Across America: Boston, MA
name.html: Beer Camp Across America: Boston, MA

description.text:
We’ve partnered with 30 of the best brewers in America on the largest collaboration ever attempted. This summer, we’re hitting the road and we’ve invited every brewer in the U.S. to join us! Brewers and beer drinkers on the eastern seaboard—from Virginia to Maine—have created an incredible craft beer culture and true pub scene that rivals any in the world. 
Join us in Boston to celebrate the craft beer community and the importance of collaboration! We’ll be having beers in the heart of the city and enjoying the best of Boston’s food truck scene. 
Check the website for all the information you’re looking for: Beer Camp Across America Boston

description.text:
Guided by designers and architects, families will choose a construction site from a fictional city grid, design and build a building from recycled materials, and be awarded a certificate of occupancy from the City building inspectors. KidsBuild! lets kids formulate their ideas about architecture, design and construction as they build a city from the ground up. 
KidsBuild! is designed for children age five – 13. A maximum ratio of 3 children per 1 adult will be required. Tickets are free. Family members will work together to build a design for 1 site in the city. When choosing a registration time, indicate the number of people in your group. 
A few things to keep in mind: We have spaced out the registration times to avoid over crowding in the Construction Yard. PLEASE come during your assigned time. Depending on your design, the building process will take between 1.5 and 2.5 hours. You may take as much time as you need. For more information on KidsBuild! go to kidsbuild.org  
BSA Space is one block from South Station. Enter through the BSA Space entrance and follow the signs for KidsBuild! Your registration includes acceptance of our photo release and consent policy. 
KidsBuild! 2016 is a program of the BSA Foundation, and is supported by the Massachusetts Cultural Council, Atlantic Wharf and other generous sponsors.

description.text:
Alpha Epsilon Pi and Northeastern Hillel's annual philanthropy event is back, so get ready for Jews Cruise 2016!  
This year's event will be better than ever, with more tickets available and 100% of the event's proceeds donated to Heroes to Heroes! Heroes to Heroes helps American veterans suffering from PTSD and Moral Injury reintegrate into society and return to civilian life. You can learn more on their website. 
Ticket sales will be opening at 7:30pm on Monday, March 21st! 
  
FAQs 
  
Is there a dress code? 
Yes! Semi-formal, dress to impress! 
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
Yes! You must bring your ID to the event! You must be 18 years or age or older to enter the event and 21 years of age or older to drink on the boat. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
You can either bring a paper copy or digital copy on your phone, but you must have a ticket with a QR code to enter.  
  
Do I need to be a Northeastern student to attend? 
Nope! There are no restrictions on who can attend the event other than a minimum age of 18 years old.  
  
What is the refund policy? 
Unfortunately, there are no refunds on tickets. However, we aren't keeping your money, it's going to a great cause. All of the money will be donated to Heroes to Heroes, an organization that is doing some great work for our veterans. If you would like to transfer your ticket to someone else, please contact us. 
  
Can I sell my ticket to someone else? 
In Massachusetts it is illegal to sell a ticket for more than $2 above its face value. As a charity event, we ask that if you must sell your ticket you sell it to the other person at face value. To verify that tickets are only being sold honestly, we will be checking IDs at the door. If the name on your ID does not match the name on the ticket you will not be admitted. If you sell your ticket to someone else please use the link to "Contact the Organizer" and we'll work to get your ticket transferred.

name.text: Harvard China Forum 2016 | 哈佛中国论坛 2016
name.html: Harvard China Forum 2016 | 哈佛中国论坛 2016

description.text:
Founded in 1998, Harvard China Forum is the leading student organized China conference in the world. For nineteen years, the Forum has provided an unrivaled platform for world leaders to debate and address issues that will impact the future of China.  
哈佛中国论坛成立于1998年，是北美领先的由学生组织的中国话题论坛。十九年来，我们一直致力于打造群英荟萃的交流平台，让政商文化各界翘楚分享见解，启发灵感，破除成见，展望未来，让与会者聆听经验，汲取智慧，并在未来面对与中国切身相关的问题时能够学以致用，有所裨益。 
The 19th Harvard China Forum will be held on April 8th-10th, 2016 (Friday evening through Sunday afternoon) at Hynes Convention Center, Boston. Building upon the legacy set forth by previous conferences, this year's conference will feature numerous prominent thinkers, leaders, and pioneers across a multitude of industries and professions. Some of our speakers include (in alphabetical order): 
第19届哈佛中国论坛将于2016年4月8日至10日（周五晚至周日下午）在波士顿Hynes Convetion Center举行。本次论坛将延续往届传统，邀请到各领域的精英领袖和神秘的重量级嘉宾。本届部分嘉宾包括 （按姓氏字母排序）： 
  


陈漫 国际知名摄影艺术家 Chen Man Fashion Photographer 


陈一冰 奥运体操冠军 Chen Yibing Olympic Gold Medallist in Gymnastics 


Mark Elliott 哈佛大学副教务长 Mark Elliott Vice Provost, Harvard University 


范钧 万合天宜首席执行官 Fan Jun Chief Executive Officer, UniMedia 


高文慧 庆丰包子铺总经理 Gao Wenhui President, Qingfeng Steamed Dumpling Shop 


韩小红 慈铭体检健康管理集团总裁 Han Xiaohong CEO, Ciming Checkup 


胡祖六 春华资本集团创始合伙人 Hu Zuliu Founding Partner, Primavera Capital 


William Kirby 哈佛大学工商管理学教授 William Kirby Professor in Business Administration, Harvard University 


Elaine La Roche 摩根士丹利全球前首席运营官、中金公司前首席执行官 Elaine La Roche Former Chief of Staff to the Chairman, Morgan Stanley; Former CEO, China International Capital Corp 


李丰 峰瑞资本合伙人 Li Feng Founding Partner, FreeS Fund 


刘建宏 乐视体育首席内容官 Liu Jianhong Chief Content Officer, Lesports 


龙宇 贝塔斯曼亚洲投资基金创始及管理合伙人 Long Yu Founding and Managing Partner, Bertelsmann Asia Investments 


Krishna Palepu 哈佛商学院经济管理学教授 Krishna Palepu Professor in Business Administration, Harvard Business School 


沈黎晖 草莓音乐节创始人 Shen Lihui Founder, Strawberry Music Festival 


Atle Skalleberg Student Universe首席执行官 Atle Skalleberg CEO, Student Universe 


王波明《财经》杂志总编 Wang Boming Editor-in-Chief, Caijing Magazine 


王维嘉 美通无线董事长 Wang Weijia Chairman, Meitong Wireless 


王祖继 中国建设银行行长 Wang Zuji President, China Construction Bank 


谢宏 贝因美创始人 Xie Hong Founder, Beingmate 


徐小平 真格基金创始人 Xu Xiaoping Founder, ZhenFund 


阎焱 软银赛富亚洲投资基金首席合伙人 Andrew Yan, Managing Partner of SAIF Partners III and SB Asia Investment Fund II 


叶蓓 著名女歌手 Ye Bei Singer 


叶朋 陆金所总经理、前阿里巴巴集团副总裁 Ye Peng President, Lufax; Former Vice CEO, Alibaba 


詹华 太合麦田首席执行官 Zhan Hua CEO, Taihe Rye Music 


...... 等等 and many more  


  
 (Speakers featured in each panel will be released periodically through our Wechat account. Please scan the QR code below to follow our Wechat account in order to receive the latest updates.) 
  
Tickets prices: 
Students: $75 
Professionals: $200 
  
票价如下： 
学生票：$75 
非学生票：$200 
  
＊The tickets include entry pass for all 3 days of our conference. Free simultaneous translation will be provided for non-Chinese speakers. Holders of “Harvard Students” and “Other Students” tickets will be asked to present their student IDs upon entering the conference venue. 
＊门票包括论坛三天会议的全程入场券。哈佛学生和其他学生须在入场时出示学生证。 
  
This year's HCF will also feature a Pitch Competition, a platform for entrepreneurs to present their China-related startup ideas. Participants will receive feedback from seasoned judges, who may choose to directly invest in those startups. There will also be networking opportunities and a career fair for participants to forge valuable connections.   
  
Please follow our Wechat account ("harvardchina", or scan the QR code below) to receive the latest updates regarding this year's speakers, or send an email to contact@harvardchina.org with the subject line "Subscribe" so that we can put you on our mailing list. For questions, please email contact@harvardchina.org.

description.text:
***Tickets on sale at 10am on Tuesday, March 15*** 
Summer in Boston is a great time. And, if there's one food that we think of during this season, it's BBQ. Meat lovingly slow smoked for hours, while drinking a few craft beers...and then enjoyed with a few more. Yep, that sounds like heaven to us! Not everyone has the time or skill to smoke their own BBQ, though, so we've taken care of that part for you. Join us for the Boston Beer & BBQ Fest and you can start right at the enjoyment step! 20 New England craft brewers and cideries along with 5 local BBQ joints. How can this be anything but great?! 
Find out why Drink Craft Beer was awarded Boston magazine's Best of Boston® 2014 - Best Booze Fest! 
Please Note: 

There are no refunds OR exchanges.
All attendees must be 21+ with a valid ID. Nobody will be allowed into the building who is under 21 or who doesn't have a valid ID.
Tickets will be emailed by Eventbrite. You must bring this ticket to the event where it will be scanned.
You can transfer tickets using Eventbrite.
We give no entry guarantee if you buy your ticket from a reseller.

Boston Beer & BBQ Fest July 15th and 16th  
Space 57, 200 Stuart Street, Boston, MA 02116 Session 1 - Friday, July 15th: 6-9:30pm Session 2 - Saturday, July 16th: 1-4:30pm Session 3 - Saturday, July 16th: 6-9:30pm 
 
***Tickets on sale at 10am on Tuesday, March 15*** 
Why Join Us At Boston Beer & BBQ Fest? 
Why NOT to join us, that's really the question! It's smoked meat and local craft beer and cider. Do you really need more than that? If you do need more info, though, we can tell you that the Boston Beer & BBQ Fest focuses on New England-made craft beers and ciders as well as showcasing some of the best local BBQ joints around. By attending you'll have access to over 70 craft beers and ciders, as well as mountains of BBQ. Honestly, now tell us...what more do you need to know?! 
How Much Does It Cost? 
For only $55 you’ll get admittance to one session which includes: 

Unlimited 2oz samples of 70+ New England craft beers & ciders
A sample from each of the 5 local BBQ joints
Biodegradable tasting cup
Fest Guide

What BBQ Will be Joining? 
We're working hard to get a great lineup of 5 BBQ joints together. Right now we have the following committed: 

Blue Ribbon BBQ - West Newton, MA & Arlington, MA
More to come

What Breweries Will be Joining? 
We will have 20 New England brewers and cider makers in attendance bringing over 70 craft beers and ciders. Some of our brewers include the following (NOTE: This is only a partial list. We'll continue to announce more of our brewers and beers in the coming weeks) (Brewers and beers are subject to change and availability. All pours are 2oz per MA State Law): 

Backlash Beer (MA)
Far From the Tree Cider (MA)
Hidden Cove Brewing Co. (ME)
Jack's Abby Brewing Co. (MA)
Lookout Farm Hard Cider (MA)
Mayflower Brewing Co. (MA)
Slumbrew (MA)
Trillium Brewing Co. (MA)
More to come

What Food Will Be Available? 
While you’ll have your fill of craft beer, cider and local bbq samples, we know you might want something a little more substantial. With that in mind, this is normally where we'd tell you the restaurants we're bringing in...but in this case, we've already got some of the best BBQ in Massachusetts joining us...why would we look any further? So they'll be selling more substantial portions, on top of sampling.

We'll continue to announce more of our brewers and beers in the coming weeks) (Brewers and beers are subject to change and availability. All pours are 2oz per MA State Law):

  • Backlash Beer (MA)
  • Far From the Tree Cider (MA)
  • Hidden Cove Brewing Co. (ME)
  • Jack's Abby Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Lookout Farm Hard Cider (MA)
  • Mayflower Brewing Co. (MA)
  • Slumbrew (MA)
  • Trillium Brewing Co. (MA)
  • More to come

What Food Will Be Available?

While you’ll have your fill of craft beer, cider and local bbq samples, we know you might want something a little more substantial. With that in mind, this is normally where we'd tell you the restaurants we're bringing in...but in this case, we've already got some of the best BBQ in Massachusetts joining us...why would we look any further? So they'll be selling more substantial portions, on top of sampling.

description.text:
About the Conference: 

This year’s 2016 ODSC East brings together the most influential data scientists, practitioners, innovators, and thought leaders in data science and big data.
ODSC East showcases the best and the brightest when it comes to data science, including many open source data science pioneers.
This three-day event will feature 10 training sessions, 20 workshops, and 100 speakers.

Training Sessions & Workshops  

Prepare for the conference by attending one of the 10 training sessions. 
Further your knowledge at one of the 20 conference workshops.

Main Conference: Languages, Tools, and Topics 
We’re heavily focused on applied data science featuring real-world applications. Here’s a list of languages, tools, and topics we cover in our workshops and talks: 

R
Hadoop
Predictive Analytics
Python
Spark
Machine Learning
Pig/Hive
MongoDB
Natural Language Processing 
SQL
Vowpal Wabbit
Deep Learning
Julia 
Elastic Search
Problematic Programming

6 ADDITIONAL PARALLEL CONFERENCES 

Choose your conference, or forge your own path. 

In addition to the data-science core-conference, we’ve organized six other mini-conferences highlighting these collaborations and convergences. Choose a conference to follow — or create your own from pieces of each. 

Design and Visualization / Create graphics and stories with data
Careers and Training / Land the “sexiest” job of the 21st century
Data Science Innovation / Make data drive the most successful products and services
Data Science for Good / Hack to make the world a better place
Big Data Science / Witness the intersection of big data and data analytics
Open Data / Harness the universe of free data

  
Rockstar Speakers 
We’re gathering the best and brightest in data science. 

Coming soon!

  
Networking Opportunities 
Connect with attendees from the leading data science companies. 

Job Lounge / Cross paths with companies looking to hire talented data scientists
Office Hours Session / Drop in and bring your questions, big and small

  
FAQs 
Is my registration/ticket transferrable?  
Yes; email info@odsc.com with your full name, email address and the full name, email address, company name, and title of the person to whom you are transferring. 
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?  
questions@odsc.com 
 What is the Privacy Policy? 
In summary; registrant contact information is NOT shared with third parties without your consent. Registrant information is primarily used to verify registration and notify you of similar events held by ODSC in future. We may share your contact information with sponsors but only with your consent upon registering. 
What is the Refund Policy? 
Cancellations within 30 days of the event are non-refundable. 
  
Visit our event website for more infomration.

description.text:
Ballgames, brats and brews…Boston Grown-Ups Museum is back so spread the news!! Get ready to kick off spring with a night dedicated to one of Boston’s favorite games!! Show off your expert corn hole skills, throw your best fast ball in our Speed Pitch, and make it to the last block with our giant Jenga set.   
Ever wanted to visit Boston Children's Museum...without the children? Race to the the top of the three-story Climb, build a towering fortress, blow a giant bubble, and remember what it's like to be a kid? Now is your chance! 
On Thursday, April 14th, we're throwing open the doors to Boston Children's Museum to those who are young at heart. Enjoy beer and wine plus tasty treats for purchase. Bring friends and meet new ones as you explore interactive exhibits, attempt to build a "big kid" sized fort, and explore your inner artist in the Art Studio.  
Whether you were here as a kid or are new to town, Boston "Grown-Ups" Museum will bring out your innate sense of fun! 
Cover $25 
Big Kids Only (21+) you must bring valid ID Cash Bar 
 Questions? For inquiries on group rates or any further questions please email BGM@BostonChildrensMuseum.org or call (617) 986-3649.  
Advanced tickets are required and will be scanned upon entry. 
No refunds will be processed for this event.

description.text:
Boston's most popular recurring tech is back with the 2nd meetup under the new BiG name. Join us to celebrate our city's early stage tech innovation. 
Open to everyone in the community. 
On Twitter: Use the hashtag #BIG2 and follow us at @BIGinnovators. 
  
Agenda: 
6:30pm: Arrival, Cash Bar, General Mingling 
7pm: "Main Dish" Demos will present on stage: 

Meta Search - Google for your files. Search your Desktop, Google Drive, Dropbox, Gmail, Evernote, and everything else the way you’d search the Internet.
VocaliD - Mapping the vocal genome to bring speaking machines to life.
Troupe - A platform where anyone can design, buy, and sell stunning custom jewelry.

6-9pm: "Side Dish" Demos will demo throughout the night: 

Nature, Inc - Their product, the Smart AC Plug, is like Nest for room air conditioners.
Who's That - Meet awesome people with your friends over complimentary drinks.
SimpliShip - A dynamic freight marketplace connecting you to instant rate quotes and forwarders competing for your shipment.
Unigma - Unigma's mission is to help IT services providers become Cloud Service Providers, by helping extend their services offerings to public clouds and connected devices.
Red5 Pro - Red5 Pro allows you to build scalable live streaming and second screen apps; add two way live audio, video and data streaming to your app with just a few lines of code using our iOS & Android SDKs.
Yoke.io - Track activity across your cloud accounts.

  
If your startup is interested in demo'ing, please apply by emailing david@bostoninnovatorsgroup.com with the folloing info: name of your company/site/product, a brief overview and descriptio, and a link to your site or demo.

description.text:
Photography, Video & Recording Policy 
When you attend a Drool Baby Expo event or program, you enter an area where photography, audio, and video recording may occur. 
By entering the event premises, you consent to interview(s), photography, audio recording, video recording and its/their release, publication, exhibition, or reproduction to be used for news, web casts, promotional purposes, telecasts, advertising, inclusion on websites, or any other purpose by Drool Baby Expo and its affiliates and representatives. You release Drool Baby Expo, its officers and employees, and each and all persons involved from any liability connected with the taking, recording, digitizing, or publication of interviews, photographs, computer images, video and/or or sound recordings. 
By entering the event premises, you waive all rights you may have to any claims for payment or royalties in connection with any exhibition, streaming, web casting, televising, or other publication of these materials, regardless of the purpose or sponsoring of such exhibiting, broadcasting, web casting, or other publication irrespective of whether a fee for admission or sponsorship is charged. You also waive any right to inspect or approve any photo, video, or audio recording taken by Drool Baby Expo or the person or entity designated to do so by Drool Baby Expo. 
You have been fully informed of your consent, waiver of liability, and release before entering the event. 
Cancellation Policy 
The deadline to receive a refund for an individual ticket is three business days (72 hours) before the day of the event. Refunds requested after April 4th will be denied. Tickets purchased after April 4, 2016 are non-refundable. 
Gift Bag Policy 
Please note there is a limit of one gift bag per family. Gift bags are required to be picked up at the show during exhibitor hours. Gift bags cannot be mailed or picked up at a different location on another date.

description.text:
We'll be celebrating the best beers from over 50 different breweries on Marathon Weekend in Boston. It's a celebration of the best beers in the world on April 15 & 16, 2016. Check in on Facebook for the most recent news. 
We have three sessions: 

4/15 Friday Night  6 - 9:30pm
4/16 Saturday Afternoon  12:30 - 4pm
4/16 Saturday Night  5:30 - 9pm

What is the Beer Summit? The Boston Beer Summit is a craft beer tasting, with over 50 brewers and 200+ beersto sample. It has been happening in Boston since 1999, and gets bigger and better every year. This event will have many of the best local, regional, national and international brewers in the world represented- bringing both their well known year round and less common seasonal brews. Your ticket includes entrance, entertainment, tasting mug and beer samples. 
  
  
Who's Coming So Far?  
The New England Elite:  Artifact Cider Project, Backlash Beer Company, Bad Martha, Bay State, Bent Water Brewing, Blue Hills Brewery, Castle Island Brewing, Clown Shoes Beer, Down the Road Brewery, Downeast Cider House, Flying Dreams Brewing, Fort Hill, Gardner Ale House, Harpoon, Ipswich Ale Brewery, Lookout Farm Hard Cider, Mighty Squirrel, Paper City Brewery, Peak Organic, Samuel Adams, Kennebec River Brewery, Foolproof, Grey Sail, Narragansett Beer and Woodstock Inn & Brewery.   
The World Class Crafts: Angry Orchard, Brooklyn Brewery, Browns Brewing Company, Saranac, Coronado Brewing, Humboldt Brewing, Lagunitas, Speakeasy Ales & Lagers, Oskar Blues Brewery, D.G. Yuengling & Son, Weyerbacher Brewing, Shiner, Uinta Brewing Company, Hofbrau, Dinkel Acker, Stiegl, O’Hara’s Brewery, Dingle Brewing, Brouwerij Van Steenberge, De Brabandere and Brouwerij Van Honesbroukck. 
  
FAQs 
What's included? 
Your ticket includes entrance, entertainment, tasting mug and all samples. 
Food available? 
Definitely- we'll be announcing the food partners soon. 
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
Beer Summit is 21+ 
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
Nearest T Stations: Green Line - Arlington Walk South down Arlington Street AWAY from the Boston Commons.  Orange/ Green- Back Bay Walk East down Columbus toward the Park Plaza 
Parking:  Parking is EXTREMELY limited, so take the T instead! 
Is my registration/ticket transferrable? 
We do allow transfers to friends 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
You will get in faster if you do 
What is the refund policy? 
Event is held rain or shine, no refunds.

name.text: The 17th Annual Postgraduate Nutrition Symposium — THE ADIPOCYTE IN ENERGY REGULATION at The Joseph B. Martin Conference Center at Harvard Medical School
name.html: The 17th Annual Postgraduate Nutrition Symposium — THE ADIPOCYTE IN ENERGY REGULATION at The Joseph B. Martin Conference Center at Harvard Medical School

description.text:
*Please Note the Annual Symposium will be held at the Martin Center this Year* 
PROGRAM 
Day 1 - Wednesday, July 13th, 2016 
7:15 am Registration & Continental Breakfast 
8:00 am Welcome & Introductions - Steven K. Grinspoon, MD - Harvard Medical School  
8:10 am Keynote Address: The Adipocyte in Systemic Energy Regulation - Philipp E. Scherer, PhD - University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center 
SESSION I: Molecular Regulation of Adipose Tissue 
9:00 am Novel Adipocyte Signaling Mechanisms - C. Ronald Kahn, MD - Harvard Medical School 
9:45 am Coffee Break 
10:15 am Physiological Signaling by Adipose Tissue in Hunger and Energy Homeostasis - Sadaf Farooqi, PhD, FRCP - University of Cambridge 
11:00 am Novel Class of Signaling Lipids with Beneficial Metabolic and Anti-Inflammatory Effects - Barbara B. Kahn, MD - Harvard Medical School 
11:45 am Roundtable Discussion: Morning Participants 
12:15 pm Lunch 
SESSION II: Session II: Adipocytes in Energy Homeostasis – Lessons from Evolutionary Biology 
1:00 pm Introductions 
1:15 pm Evolutionary Lessons from Fat Storage - Nicolas Rohner, PhD - Stowers Institute for Medical Research 
2:00 pm Adipose Tissue Regulation During Starvation – Conserved Pathways Across Species - Alexander A. Soukas, MD, PhD - Harvard Medical School 
2:45 pm Circadian Rhythms in Adipose Tissue - Jeffrey M. Gimble, MD, PhD - Tulane University School of Medicine 
3:30 pm Roundtable Discussion: Afternoon Participants 
4:00 pm Special Lecture: Mitochondrial Biogenesis and Implications for Metabolic Dysregulation in Human Disease - Vamsi K. Mootha, MD - Harvard Medical School 
4:45 pm Closing Remarks/Adjourn 
  
DAY 2 - Thursday, July 14th, 2016  
7:15 am Registration & Continental Breakfast 
8:00 am Welcome & Introductions  
SESSION III: Novel Adipocyte Phenotyping 
8:15 am Overview of Brown Fat Biology - Bruce M. Spiegelman, PhD - Harvard Medical School  
9:00 am Therapeutic Activators of Brown Fat - Aaron M. Cypess, MD, PhD, MMSc - National Institutes of Health – National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases 
9:45 am Adipose Tissue and Lipid Imaging - Martin P. Torriani, MD - Harvard Medical School 
10:30 am Coffee Break 
11:00 am Adipocyte Inflammatory Profiles - Gokhan S. Hotamisligil, MD, PhD - Harvard School of Public Health 
11:45 am Insights from Lipidomics - Robert E. Gerszten, MD - Harvard Medical School 
12:30 pm Roundtable Discussion  
1:00 pm Closing Remarks/Adjourn

description.text:
Join us for ProductCamp Boston 2016  Saturday, April 9, 2016 
Your $10 admission helps pay for food. Event hours: 7:45 am - 3:15 pm (time may change) 
Microsoft New England Research and Development Center  One Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA 
PRODUCTCAMP BOSTON the only full-day unconference for product managers and product marketers in the Boston area, and the second largest ProductCamp in the world. Because it's an unconference, ProductCamp is organized by attendees, for attendees so you can get the most out of the day.  
LEARN NEW TECHNIQUES in product management, product marketing, product development, go-to-market, product strategy and lifecycle management, UX, startups, career development - and more.

description.text:
Please join President Joseph E. Aoun and Pulitzer Prize-winning editor and digital media innovator Marty Baron for a conversation about the future of media. Currently leading one of the most influential news organizations, The Washington Post, Baron has been a news media pioneer with remarkable successes in an industry that has recently experienced profound disruption 
The two will discuss the exciting future of the media industry in the digital world. 
Previously, Baron had been editor of The Boston Globe. During his tenure, the Globe won six Pulitzer Prizes, including one for their Spotlight investigation which inspired the Academy Award-winning movie Spotlight. 
This event is part of "The Future of…”, a presidential speaker series that explores what's on the horizon for the topics that shape our lives.  Each event features a conversation with a leading thinker and innovator on themes like food, dating, the media — and more. 
“The Future of Media” A talk with The Washington Post executive editor and digital media innovator Martin “Marty” Baron Thursday, March 31st  4 p.m. East Village, 17th Floor 
Reception to follow

name.text: [HCSSA][哈佛名家讲坛] 六小龄童：苦练七十二变，笑对八十一难 ——西游文化的智慧与哲理
name.html: [HCSSA][哈佛名家讲坛] 六小龄童：苦练七十二变，笑对八十一难 ——西游文化的智慧与哲理

description.text:
哈佛名家讲坛 
Harvard China Speakers Series 
  
六小龄童： 
苦练七十二变，笑对八十一难 
——西游文化的智慧与哲理 
  
 
  
六小龄童：著名表演艺术家、我国戏曲艺术大师六龄童的幼子、荣获国务院特殊津贴、中宣部“四个一批”人才、中央电视台国家一级演员、无党派人士、中国人民大学荣誉教授、中国西游文化研究会副会长、吴承恩纪念馆荣誉馆长、吴承恩中学荣誉校长、英国中华传统文化研究院荣誉院长、英中文化友好使者、法中文化大使、日中儿童友好协会荣誉主席、泰中文化艺术交流协会永远名誉主席、越中文化体育旅游形象大使、缅中友好文化大使，曾获加拿大“杰出华人艺术家”称号。2014年10月15日习近平总书记主持召开的北京文艺座谈会72位代表之一。中国人民大学、云南师范大学等校的荣誉教授。著有自传《六小龄童·猴缘》及机械工业出版社出版的六小龄童丛书系列（包括《六小龄童品西游》、《听孙悟空说西游》、典藏版《西游记》）。2015年7月7日，联合国教科文组织总部、法国尼斯市政府等在尼斯由副市长颁发“和平大使：六小龄童先生”荣誉证书。2015年2月16日成为中国内地演艺界走上牛津大学讲坛讲演的第一人。2015年4月29日六小龄童所塑造的孙悟空形象成为英国杜莎夫人蜡像馆成立近二百年以来入驻的首位神话人物形象。2015年2月23日荣获文化部、中国艺术家协会等颁发的“德艺双馨终身成就奖”。继2004年9月27日开馆的淮安美猴王世家艺术馆、2012年6月16日开馆的上海六小龄童艺术馆、2015年7月26日开馆的陕西铜川玉华宫六小龄童艺术馆后，2015年11月29日在云南师范大学开设“六小龄童图书阁”。2015年11月25日在马来西亚吉隆坡获得“世界杰出名人榜”终身成就奖。2015年12月20日获得“2015品牌中国年度人物终身成就奖”并当选为“品牌中国产业联盟”副主席。 
  
时间 
Friday, March 25, 2016 from 7:30PM to 9:00PM (EST) 
  
地点与注册 
本次活动地点位于哈佛大学主校区，请大家注册获取免费票。注册成功后将收到通过Eventbrite发送的电子票，包含具体地点信息，为PDF格式的附件。由于本次讲座预计观众数量巨大，请大家尽早注册，凭票入场。如不能参加烦请取消order，把位置留给waiting list上的朋友，感谢您的理解与支持！ 
  
招募志愿者 
https://goo.gl/jYPX7s （或扫如下二维码） 
 
  

哈佛大学中国学生学者联合会 
Harvard Chinese Students and Scholars Association (HCSSA) Lehman Hall ∙ Harvard University ∙ Cambridge  website: www.hcssa.org 
email:  harvardcssa@gmail.com 
facebook: Harvard CSSA 
Twitter: Harvard CSSA 
OrgSquare: Harvard CSSA 
微博： 哈佛大学中国学联 
微信公众号：HarvardCSSA

name.text: Perks Convention Spring 2016 at Microsoft NERD Center
name.html: Perks Convention Spring 2016 at Microsoft NERD Center

description.text:
What is PERKS?  
PERKS brings together creative solutions for the office that improve workplace culture, create convenience, and increase happiness. 
For three years in a row, the PERKS Convention has showcased the coolest on-site services for your office. For one night we bring together the most fun and impactful providers working in health & wellness, convenience, food & beverage, facilities and entertainment. PERKS gives the opportunity for companies to see the most innovative and unique on-site services available.  
Our Spring 2016 Exhibitors - more to be announced!    
 
 
  
 
 
The PERKS Convention would like to thank our generous sponsors and partners.  
Their dedication makes this event possible for the benefit of all our participants and attendees. Thank you for your continued support of the PERKS mission!  
 
 
FAQs  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
MBTA: The Microsoft NERD Center is walking accessible from the Kendall/MIT T station. Parking: Paid for parking is available in the garage of the Microsoft NERD Center as well as the surrounding area. Please note that we do not validate or offer dicounts on parking and space is on a first come first serve basis.  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
Please reach out to info@awesomeemployeeperks.com with any questions.

name.text: TSNE's 2015-16 Better Nonprofit Management Training Series
name.html: TSNE's 2015-16 Better Nonprofit Management Training Series

description.text:
The Better Nonprofit Management Training Series provides ongoing learning designed for nonprofit professionals. The series includes multiple workshops to help managers, staff, board members and other key stakeholders strengthen their management skills. Register now. 
For full workshop descriptions and series information visit http://tsne.org/training/better-nonprofit-management-training-series 
  
FAQs 
What is the refund policy? 
Cancellations must be made via email at least 10 business days prior to the date of the workshop in order to receive a refund (less a $15 processing fee). Email trainings@tsne.org should you need to cancel your registration. 
  
Where are your workshops located? 
Unless otherwise noted, all workshops are held at TSNE's NonProfit Center, conveniently located in Downtown Boston at 89 South Street, Boston 02111, near public transportation. For detailed directions, helpful information about visiting the NonProfit Center, and parking options please visit http://www.nonprofitcenterboston.org/directions 
  
Are there ID requirements? 
You will need valid identification to check in with security at the building's front desk. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
No, this is not necessary. 
  
Additional Questions?  
Email trainings@tsne.org

name.text: HESA Presents The 6th Annual Masquerade Ball
name.html: HESA Presents The 6th Annual Masquerade Ball

description.text:
A spectacular event Uniting Harvard and The Networking Event of the year!   
Aboard the Odyssey Cruise Ship in Boston Harbor at Rowes Wharf. Three floors of temperature controlled rooms with dance flors and DJ's on two levels. VIP can experience the private third floor lounge and deck. Ship leaves promptly at 8pm.  
Masks will be on sale here and day of, they will be available to pick up on campus or at the event. 
Open to ALL Students, Must be 21+ to purchase alcohol. Under 21 will wear wrist bands. You will need a valid government issued ID to purchase alcohol. All students status will be verified or your tickets will be cancelled and no refunds given. No refunds or exchanges for any reason.  You will trade in your eventbrite ticket for a boarding pass at the dock.

name.text: UXPA Boston 15th Annual User Experience Conference
name.html: UXPA Boston 15th Annual User Experience Conference

description.text:
Our schedule is now LIVE! See more details about the sessions and presenters on Sched. 
Join us on Friday April 29, 2016 for the 15th UXPA Boston Annual Conference at the Sheraton Boston, Boston, MA. Hear and discuss critical topics in usability and user-centered design with practitioners, students, and experts in the field. Whether a newcomer, a seasoned user experience professional, or a member of a product team interested in usability, this conference offers unique content and one-of-a-kind learning opportunities. 
We expect more than 900 industry professionals to attend and we will close registration when full. Sign up today! This is the place to be for learning about best practices for user-centered product development, usability research, and real-world case studies from website, mobile device, software, healthcare, globalization and other fields! 
Over 30 speakers, plus many opportunities to make new professional connections.  
This conference has an unprecedented number of presentations going on to provide a greater diversity of session topics. The conference will have four simultaneous tracks + an unconference track, giving you a choice of almost 30 presentations. Topics are relevant to thought-leaders, designers, developers, usability professionals, usability novices, and others. There's something for everyone! 
 
Amazing Sponsors! 
This year the event will have even more sponsors giving attendees the opportunity to network and discover companies that are hiring, meet local design and usability organizations, and try out new technologies and products. Many sponsorships include conference admission as part of the package. We encourage large employers, agencies and recruiters to gain additional exposure by sponsoring.  
Joining UXPA International 
UXPA Boston is a local chapter of UXPA International. While membership in the Boston chapter is free, we encourage you to join UXPA International to receive global benefits, discounts to UXPA chapter events, and to support the sustained practice of UX worldwide. 
Financial Hardship 
If you are a potential attendee of the conference and would incur financial hardship paying the registration fee, there are several options we may suggest. Email us at president@uxpaboston.org and we’ll see what accommodations can be made. All inquiries will be handled with discretion. 
Refunds 
Attendees may request a full refund through Eventbrite up to two weeks before the conference. Attendees can transfer their registration to another attendee up to the night before the conference. 
Attendee changes made within two weeks of the conference will not be reflected on name tags. Please ask for a new name tag at registration. 
  
Code of Conduct 
Anyone attending a UXPA Boston event is expected to review and ahere to our code of conduct.

name.text: 9th Annual 98.5 The Sports Hub and Patrice Bergeron's Cuts for a Cause
name.html: 9th Annual 98.5 The Sports Hub and Patrice Bergeron's Cuts for a Cause

description.text:
Join Patrice Bergeron, 98.5 The Sports Hub and some of your favorite Bruins for the 9th Annual Cuts for a Cause. Bergeron and his teammates will have their heads shaved by auction winners to show their support and raise money for the Boston Bruins Foundation and Floating Hospital for Children at Tufts Medical Center.  To attend the event, fans can choose from two ticket options:  1. General Admission tickets: $30  

Access to the event from 4:30 to 6:00 PM

 2. VIP tickets: $200 - Limited inventory 

Early access to the event from 3:00 to 4:00 PM
Opportunity to get one item signed by select Boston Bruins Players

VIP attendees will have the opportunity to select from two different VIP options which will allow them to meet ½ of the Bruins Players who are participating in the event. 
Guest will only be guaranteed to see two specific players in the VIP session. 
Guests will be able to make their own selection of which two players they will get to meet at the time of purchasing tickets.  

VIP Gold Session – Patrice Bergeron and David Krejci
VIP Black Session – Zdeno Chara and Brad Marchand


Guests will not be permitted to enter either VIP session with more than one item. No bags or sticks of any kind will be permitted into the event. 
Please note, players attending Cuts for a Cause are subject to change at any time. 

Bruins fans can bid on the opportunity to shave the head of their favorite participating Bruins player by visiting this page! Be sure to check back here on Monday, March 17 when the bidding begins. Auction winners will also receive admission to the VIP session where they will meet and greet the players on the event floor and receive a special Bruins gift bag that includes autographed Bruins memorabilia.

name.text: FREE Class at Soul.Train. for NEW Students!
name.html: FREE Class at Soul.Train. for NEW Students!

description.text:
This ticket is good for your first FREE Class at Soul.Train. Valid for First time clients, only. Valid for all Soul.Train. classes EXCEPT Crazy 8's. Please check out website for our class schedule: http://soultrainfitness.com. 
You will NOT be able to sign up for your free class in advance. Simply bring this voucher with you to your first class and make sure to create an account on our MindBody scheduler (found on our website) prior to coming in.  
Soul.Train. is a privately owned dual level personal training and group exercise fitness studio. We offer an array of different fitness services including private one on one training, small group training, and group exercise classes such as Yoga, Zumba, Pilates, Bootcamp, Interval Circuit and Kettlebells.

name.text: When Race Meets Gender: Building the Collective Power of Women
name.html: When Race Meets Gender: Building the Collective Power of Women

description.text:
You are invited to a discussion with Teresa Younger, President and CEO of the Ms. Foundation for Women. Younger has been on the frontlines of some of the most important battles for women’s health, safety and economic security. She is a tireless advocate and well-respected feminist leader, with a proven track record in nonprofit management and fundraising. She most recently served as the executive director of the Connecticut General Assembly’s Permanent Commission on the Status of Women (PCSW), where she has spearheaded successful campaigns for women’s health, safety and economic empowerment. 
                                                                           Co-sponsored by:

Whether you are looking for a fun way to spend your weekend or your next one of a kind tattoo, the Boston Tattoo Convention offers something for everyone.

name.text: Harvard Black Law Students Association Spring Conference: because, freedom.
name.html: Harvard Black Law Students Association Spring Conference: because, freedom.

description.text:
You are invited to the 33rd Annual Harvard Black Law Students Association Spring Conference. This year's theme answers the question, “Why must we continue to improve, promote, celebrate, and uplift Black life in the wake of oppression?” Our answer? “because, freedom.” Black people deserve to live our fullest, most free lives at the intersections of all of our identities, and we must work to ensure that reality. All are welcome!  The Conference will take place March 25-26, 2016 at Harvard Law School, Cambridge Massachusetts. The weekend will include a Youth Summit, a “Black Joy Matters” happy hour and mixer, panels, workshops, two keynotes, and concludes with Black "Lituation" (an official after party).  With hundreds of participants, the annual Spring Conference is Harvard BLSA’s largest event of the year. Spanning two days, this event seeks to explore the connections between the law and media, art, religion, sexuality, class, gender, professional development, and activism in 21st century Black communities.  Spring Conference provides a forum for change for more than just Harvard BLSA members, admitted students, faculty and alumni, but also for community members, artists, organizers, and students from other law schools across the world.    
Locations and speakers will be updated periodically. 
  
Friday Agenda  
     [*] Youth Summit / 10 AM - 3 PM / all day (see schedule below) 
  
     [1] Black Media, Pain, and Imagination / Noon / Ames Courtroom in Austin Hall  
     Clint Smith / poet, ph. d. student, educator / Harvard University 
     Daunasia Yancey / organizer / Black Lives Matter Boston 
     Kareem “Tef Poe” Jackson / rap artist, co-founder / Hands Up United 
     Kayla Reed /organizer / Organization for Black Struggle 
     Meggie Noel / student organizer, founder / B.L.A.C.K. at Boston Latin School 
     Aaron Bray / student, organizer / Harvard Law School 
  
     [2] Critical Race Theory Teach-In with Prof. Justin Hansford / Belinda Hall in Wasserstein / 330 PM 
     [3] "Black Joy Matters" / happy hour and mixer / Harvard Law Pub in Wasserstein Hall (WCC) / 7 PM  
  
Saturday Agenda 
Registration / 830 AM / All Day / Wasserstein Hall,1585 Massachusetts Ave., Cambridge, Massachusetts 
Breakfast & Welcome / 9 AM / Ames Courtroom in Austin Hall 
Selection: Kuumba Singers 
Speaker: Colette Pichon Battle / executive director / Gulf Coast Center for Law & Policy (GCCLP) 
  
Consecutive Panels: 
     [1] As Obama Exits: Reform, Revolution, and Solidarity 
     Location: Ames Courtroom / 10:30 AM 
     Justin Hansford, Esq. / professor, Ferguson activist / St. Louis University School of Law 
     Ifeoma Ike, Esq. / co-founder / Black and Brown People Vote (BBPV)  
     Kendra Brown / policy director / The Congressional Black Caucus  
     Carl Williams, Esq./ civil rights attorney / American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) of Massachusetts 
     Aziz Rana, Ph.D. / professor / Cornell Law 
     
     Lunch:  Darryl's Corner Kitchen and Bar Catering / Noon  
      
     [2] #SayHerName and #BlackGirlMagic: Must We Choose? 
     Location: Ames Courtroom / 12:30 PM 
     Geneva Reed-Veal / activist / Mother of Sandra Bland 
     Kei Williams / organizer, designer, writer / Black Lives Matter NYC 
     Dr. Yaba Blay / professor, producer, publisher / Pretty. Period / (1)ne Drop: Shifting the Lens on Race  
     Aja Monet / poet, songwriter, singer, human rights advocate /  Aja Monet 
     Khiara Bridges, Ph.D. / law professor and professional ballet dancer / Boston University 
  
Concurrent Panels: 
     [3] #Law4BlackLives: Building Relationships for Movement and Community Based Lawyering  
      Location: Ames Courtroom / 2 PM 
     Oren Nimni, Esq. / co-chair / National Lawyer's Guild; The United People Of Color Caucus     
     Amanda Alexander, Esq. / assistant professor and postdoctoral scholar in Afro-American studies and law /      University of Michigan 
     Purvi Shah, Esq. / director / Bertha Justice Institute, Center for Constitutional Rights 
     Amna Akbar, Esq. / assistant professor of law / The Ohio State University 
  
      [3] Finding Your Voice: Freedom in Law Firms 
       Room 1: Austin Classroom 101 East 
       Michelle Wimes, Esq. / director of professional development & inclusion / Ogletree Deakins (Kansas City) 
       Jomaire Crawford, Esq. / associate / Quinn Emanuel (New York) 
       Kwaku Akowua, Esq. / partner, supreme court and appellate group / Sidley Austin (Washington, D.C. ) 
       Brandon Whittaker / associate / Simpson Thacher & Bartlett LLP 
       Room 2: Austin Classroom 100 North  
       Jennifer Bunting-Graden / associate / Jones Day (Atlanta) 
       V. Alex Davis / associate / Sullivan Cromwell (New York) 
       Kendall Enyard / hiring partner / Steptoe & Johnson LLP 
       Everson Ladson / associate / Cleary Gottlieb (New York)  
         
       
Saturday Evening Agenda 
     Keynote Dinner / Sheraton Commander / 7 PM 
     16 Garden St, Cambridge, Massachusetts 02138 
     Speaker: umi selah / mission director / Dream Defenders 
     Black "Lituation" (After Party) / Savvor / Immediately Following Keynote Dinner 
__________________________ 
Friday Youth Summit Agenda 
          10 AM / Harvard Law Tours: Meet at Wasserstein Hall, 1585 Massachusetts Ave  
          11 AM / Lunch: Ames Courtroom in Austin Hall 
          Noon  / Black Media, Pain, and Imagination Panel: Ames Courtroom 
           1 PM / Organizing Workshop: From Tweets to the Streets: Ames Courtroom 
           3 PM / Presentations and Close
